descriptions: The fault code P0053 indicates that there is an issue with the heater resistance of the oxygen sensor in bank 1, sensor 1. This may result in poor engine performance and increased emissions.
causes: Damaged wiring or connections in the circuit
solutions: Replace the oxygen sensor
Check and repair any damaged wiring or connections
Tighten or clean any loose or corroded electrical connections
Replace the engine control module (ECM) if necessary

code_details.meaning: The fault code P0243 refers to Turbocharger Wastegate Solenoid A Malfunction.
descriptions: This fault code indicates a problem with the turbocharger wastegate solenoid circuit which controls the flow of exhaust gases to the turbocharger. This may result in poor engine performance and/or reduced fuel efficiency.
causes: Faulty wiring or connections in the circuit
Corrosion or damage to electrical connections
solutions: Replace the wastegate solenoid
Check and repair any damaged wiring or connections
Clean or replace corroded electrical connections
Replace the engine control module (ECM) if necessary

descriptions: The fault code P0300 indicates that the engine control module (ECM) has detected a random or multiple cylinder misfire. This can occur due to a number of reasons and may cause the engine to run poorly or not start at all.
causes: Faulty ignition system components (spark plugs, ignition coils, etc.)
Clogged fuel injectors or fuel filter
Faulty sensors, such as the engine coolant temperature sensor or oxygen sensor
Mechanical issues, such as low compression or a damaged valve train
solutions: Replace any faulty ignition system components (spark plugs, ignition coils, etc.)
Clean or replace clogged fuel injectors or fuel filter
Check and repair any leaks in the vacuum system
Replace any faulty sensors, such as the engine coolant temperature sensor or oxygen sensor
Perform a compression test to check for mechanical issues
Replace any damaged or worn components in the valve train
symptoms: Engine runs poorly or not at all

descriptions: The fault code P0304 indicates that there is a misfire detected in the cylinder 4 of the engine. This may result in poor engine performance, reduced fuel efficiency, and increased emissions.
causes: Vacuum leak in the intake manifold
solutions: Replace the spark plug in cylinder 4
Replace the ignition coil in cylinder 4
Check and repair any low compression issues in cylinder 4
Replace the fuel injector in cylinder 4
Inspect and repair any vacuum leaks in the intake manifold
Replace the engine control module (ECM) if necessary

descriptions: The fault code P0617 indicates that there is an issue with the starter relay control circuit. This may cause the engine to not start or may result in a no-crank condition.
causes: Corroded or damaged starter relay wiring
solutions: Replace the starter relay
Check and repair any damaged or corroded wiring
Replace the engine control module (ECM) if necessary

descriptions: The fault code P0616 indicates that there is an issue with the starter relay circuit, and the voltage in the circuit has dropped below a predetermined level.
causes: Damaged or broken wiring in the circuit
solutions: Replace the faulty starter relay
Check and repair any damaged or broken wiring in the circuit
Clean and tighten any corroded or loose electrical connections
Replace the engine control module (ECM) if necessary
symptoms: Engine won't start or is difficult to start
Clicking sound when turning the key in the ignition
No power to the starter motor

descriptions: Engine starter switch is shorted or open
solutions: Rewire starter circuit in engine compartment harness
symptoms: Check Engine Light/MIL will be on

descriptions: Engine starter switch is shorted or open
solutions: Rewire starter circuit in engine compartment harness
symptoms: Check Engine Light/MIL will be on

descriptions: The fault code P0602 indicates that there is an error in the programming of the engine control module (ECM), which may cause various drivability issues or prevent the engine from starting altogether.
causes: Corrupted or incorrect programming of the ECM
Electrical problems in the ECM circuit
Improper installation or reprogramming of the ECM
solutions: Reprogram or replace the ECM to correct the programming error
Check and repair any damaged wiring or connections in the ECM circuit
Ensure proper installation procedures are followed when replacing or reprogramming the ECM
Replace the ECM hardware if necessary
symptoms: Various drivability issues such as poor performance, stalling, or rough idling may occur

code_details.meaning: Control module Input Power " A" -Circuit voltage below threshold
descriptions: Control module Input Power " A" -Circuit voltage below threshold
